title: Basic features
text: robonomistClient package follows tidy data principles ensure returned datasets easy work ready analysis. approach helps minimize data preparation time, enabling analysts focus insights rather wrangling data. key principles used: Long Format: Data returned long format whenever possible. means row represents single observation, making ideal use popular analysis visualization tools R, ggplot2 rest tidyverse. Value Variable: long format, measured quantity captured value variable always numeric. ensures consistency across datasets facilitates easy aggregation, summarization, visualization. First Day Period: date-based data (e.g., monthly, quarterly), date represents first day period. example, “March 2024” represented "2024-03-01", making easy sort filter chronologically. Variable Arrangement: Categorical variables, represent grouping dimensions data (region, industry, demographic group), positioned left side dataset. Additional attributes related observations may positioned right side value variable. arrangement ensures categorical identifiers easily distinguishable measurement variables attributes, improving readability simplifying analysis. Consistency: tidy structure allows data seamlessly integrate typical R workflows tools data science, dplyr tidyr. using consistent formatting, robonomistClient data can easily reshaped, filtered, summarized suit wide range analytical needs.

title: Basic features
text: robonomistClient package designed simplify working data wide variety datasources. allows easily access data standardized format, freeing worrying extract wrangle data different providers. see available datasources: package keeps listed datasources automatically --date, ensuring always access current versions.

title: Special datasources
text: St. Louis Fed Database FRED contain +800k time series. avoid filling Robonomist Server table content, individual time series FRED directly visible search function. Instead, can list “sources” “releases” : database hierarchy simple: Sources contain releases, releases contain time series. list releases, example, source 1 (Board Governors Federal Reserve System), call: list time series first release list (Industrial Production Capacity Utilization), call: download time series, use get_data function: can also retrieve multiple time series providing vector ids:  FRED api also allows basic time series transformations units parameter:  Allowed values units: lin = Levels (transformation) chg = Change ch1 = Change Year Ago pch = Percent Change pc1 = Percent Change Year Ago pca = Compounded Annual Rate Change cch = Continuously Compounded Rate Change cca = Continuously Compounded Annual Rate Change log = Natural Log Similarly time series can temporally aggregated frequency aggregation_method parameters:  Allowed values frequency: d = Daily w = Weekly bw = Biweekly m = Monthly q = Quarterly sa = Semiannual = Annual Allowed values aggregation_method: avg = Average sum = Sum eop = End Period

what: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: robonomistClient package powerful R client designed simplify access diverse datasets hosted Robonomist Data Server. seamless integration, package enables analysts, researchers, developers retrieve analyze --date, multilingual data numerous national international sources, tidy format ready analysis.

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: robonomistClient package designed deliver: Comprehensive Data Coverage Access data national statistical agencies, international organizations, regional sources — one place. means less time spent searching data time analysis. Statistics Finland, OECD, World Bank, European Central Bank, . High Data Fidelity Trust data reliable accurately reflects information official statistical agencies. Complete metadata provided every dataset ensure analysis based credible information. Full transparency data sources. Detailed metadata included. Flexibility Data Retrieval Customize way data retrieved fit specific needs: Multilingual support Choose variable labels codes. Interpret time variables dates raw values. Seamless Integration Dynamic Workflows Designed work smoothly R, robonomistClient makes building dynamic documents automatically updating apps easier providing stable API: Reduce disruptions caused changing official statistics APIs. Focus insights rather wrangling data inconsistencies.

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: robonomistClient package provides seamless efficient access wide range datasources via Robonomist Data Server. support 95 197 --date data tables across 57 distinct datasources 13 languages, package designed streamline data analysis workflow. International Datasources Global Institutions: OECD, International Monetary Fund (IMF), World Bank, United Nations Economic Commission Europe Statistical Database (UNECE), United Nations Conference Trade Development (UNCTAD), FAO (Food Agriculture Organization), Bank International Settlements (BIS). European Union: Eurostat, European Commission, European Central Bank (ECB). Nordic Countries: Statistics Sweden, Swedish National Institute Economic Research, Swedish Agricultural Agency, Statistics Norway, Statistics Denmark, Statistics Iceland, Statistics Estonia, Nordic Statistics Database. Finnish Datasources Statistics Finland: StatFin, StatFin archive databases, Municipal figures & financial data, Paavo postal code area statistics, experimental statistics, immigrants integration database. Regional Data: Helsingin seudun aluesarjat -tilastotietokanta, Helsingin ympäristötilasto. National Agencies: Finnish Tax Administration, Finnish Centre Pensions, Natural Resources Institute Finland (LUKE), Traficom (Finnish Transport Communications Agency), Customs Finland, THL Sotkanet, Vipunen (Education Statistics Finland), Fingrid, TutkiHallintoa.fi (Valtiokonttori). Thematic & Specialized Datasources Energy & Environment: Entso-E Transparency Platform, U.S. Energy Information Administration database, Fingrid. Financial: Deutsche Bundesbank time series database, FRED (Federal Reserve Economic Data**. Health & Pandemic Data: THL Epirapo, ECDC. list highlights just many datasources available robonomistClient package. package also includes Robonomist’s curated tidy data tables, providing ready--use datasets tailored streamlined analysis insight generation.

text: setup Robonomist Data Server organization, please contact team@robonomist.com.

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: First, install package GitHub (haven’t already):
code: # Install devtools if necessary # install.packages("devtools")  # Install the latest version of robonomistClient from GitHub devtools::install_github("robonomist/robonomistClient")

title: Access data from Robonomist Data Server
text: start using package, need set hostname Robonomist Data Server provide access token. Use set robonomist_server() function establish connection.
code: library(robonomistClient)  # Set up the connection set_robonomist_server(hostname = "hostname.com", access_token = "abc")

what: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: data() convenience function searches database returns search results multiple matching tables found, data one match found. data_get() returns data without performing searching pattern filters. production code better use data_get() instead data() slightly faster depend search mechanism.  data_get() result error, match exists. data_search() performs search returns results.

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
code: dаta(   pattern = "",   dl_filter = NULL,   labels = getOption("robonomistClient.labels"),   lang = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   tidy_time = getOption("robonomistClient.tidy_time"),   ...  )  data_get(   id,   dl_filter = NULL,   labels = getOption("robonomistClient.labels"),   lang = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   tidy_time = getOption("robonomistClient.tidy_time"),   ... )  data_search(pattern = "")

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: pattern string, Search query table id, possibly followed §-filter. dl_filter list named vector passed datasource download functions filtering incoming data. Supported tulli, OECD ECB. labels logical, datasources can return labelled coded data. lang Two-letter language code, e.g. "en" "sv". na.rm Px-file based datasources return table combination categories. Missing values can filtered reading file improve preformance. tidy_time logical, TRUE, time dimension parsed Date class renamed time. NULL, datasource specific default used. ... Datasource-specific arguments. TODO id, string, Exact robonomist_id

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: data() function allows special §-filter. pattern matches single table function returns data frame, §-filter can used subset rows data frame. tibble filterd sequence regular expressions separated section sign §. regular expression applied data frame's variables sequentially. last variable date, used start date filter.

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
text: datasources (e.g. datasets "ecb" & "tulli") allow downloading full data tables, always preferred due large large size table. datasources user must provide download filter via dl_filter argument. argument left NULL,  data function return list variables potential values. list can used construct suitable download filter. Generally, dl_filter named list names variable names values character vectors selected values (see Examples). Alternatively, datasources allow dot-separated string define download filter.

title: Search and get data from Robonomist Data Server — data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Return information on the data table structure data("ecb/AME") ## Example of download filter data("ecb/AME", dl_filter = list(ame_ref_area = "FIN"))  data(   "ecb/FM",   dl_filter = list(     freq = "M",     provider_fm_id = "EURIBOR1YD_"   ) ) data("ecb/FM", dl_filter = "M.U2.EUR.RT.MM.EURIBOR1YD_.HSTA")  data("tulli/uljas_cpa2008",   dl_filter = list(     "Tavaraluokitus CPA2008_2" = "*A-X",     "Aika" = c("201505", "201506"),     "Maa" = "=ALL",     "Suunta" = "=FIRST 1",     "Indikaattorit" = "=FIRST 1"   ) ) } # }

title: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
text: function locks given R object x saving file .rdlock extension. file already exists (overwrite FALSE), existing file read contents returned.

title: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
code: datalock(   x,   name = NULL,   path = getOption("robonomistClient.datalock.path"),   overwrite = getOption("robonomistClient.datalock.overwrite", FALSE) )

title: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
text: x R object locked saved. name Optional; name used saved file. NULL, name generated using hash expression defines x. provided, must single non-empty character string. path Optional; directory path data file saved. Defaults value 'robonomistClient.datalock.path' option. NULL, file saved current working directory. overwrite Logical; whether overwrite existing data file. Defaults FALSE, meaning file exists, read returned without overwriting.

title: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
text: Returns data x saving reading file. overwrite TRUE, x returned saving. overwrite FALSE file exists, contents file returned. file exist, x saved returned.

title: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
text: function uses 'hash' function 'rlang' package generate file name name provided.

title: Lock and Save Data Locally — datalock
code: x <- runif(1) |> datalock(name = "example", path = "fixed_data") y <- runif(1) |> datalock(name = "example", path = "fixed_data") identical(x, y) #> [1] TRUE  # This will save `y` to a file named "example.rdlock" in the "fixed_data" path. # If the file "example.rdlock" already exists, `x` will to be evalated but read from the file.

what: Explore data by listing distinct categorical values and summarizing other variables — ogle
title: Explore data by listing distinct categorical values and summarizing other variables — ogle
text: ogle function provides quick overview contents within tibble, specifically targeting exploration categorical variables listing distinct values summarizing variable types. function useful preliminary data exploration proceeding specific data filtering analysis.

title: Explore data by listing distinct categorical values and summarizing other variables — ogle
code: ogle(.data, ...)

title: Explore data by listing distinct categorical values and summarizing other variables — ogle
text: .data tibble explore. ... <'data-masking'> Additional arguments, specifying variables included exploration. variables specified, variables tibble explored.

title: Explore data by listing distinct categorical values and summarizing other variables — ogle
text: list element corresponds variable tibble. character factor variables, returns distinct values. variables meet summary condition (defined robonomistClient:::is_summary), statistical summary returned.

title: Explore data by listing distinct categorical values and summarizing other variables — ogle
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data("sotkanet/4") %>% ogle() data("sotkanet/4") %>% ogle(region) } # }

what: Print all filtering criteria for categorical variables of a tibble — print_filter
title: Print all filtering criteria for categorical variables of a tibble — print_filter
text: function generates prints filtering criteria string categorical variables tibble. running interactive session clipr package installed, generated filter string also copied clipboard easy pasting scripts reports. particularly useful quickly generating filter conditions subsequent data manipulation tasks.

title: Print all filtering criteria for categorical variables of a tibble — print_filter
code: print_filter(.data, ...)

title: Print all filtering criteria for categorical variables of a tibble — print_filter
text: .data tibble containing data. ... <'data-masking'> Optional variables specify categorical variables include filter printout. omitted, filter criteria categorical variables generated printed.

title: Print all filtering criteria for categorical variables of a tibble — print_filter
text: function prints filtering criteria console , applicable, copies clipboard. returns original tibble invisibly chaining functions.

title: Print all filtering criteria for categorical variables of a tibble — print_filter
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data("sotkanet/4") %>% print_filter(region_category, gender) } # }

what: robonomistClient: Access data from Robonomist Data Server — robonomistClient-package
title: robonomistClient: Access data from Robonomist Data Server — robonomistClient-package
text: Easy fast access various datasources unified format via Robonomist Data Server.

text: Maintainer: Juha Itkonen juha@robonomist.com
